page.title: 07LAND USE IN HOCKWOLD
page.content: The total area of 2,500 acres of light land is divided between{farmland, {forestry}and{heathland.}About half is arable, in units varying from allotments & smallholdings to 300ac. farms. Of the{corn crops}3/4 is barley with some wheat, oats & rye. Sugarbeet is the main{root crop,}with parsnips, carrots, potatoes, turnips & peas. Beans and mangolds, grass & lucerne are used for animal fodder & grazing. A beef suckler herd of cows & calves, store cattle, sows rearing litters & poultry are the chief{livestock}kept. The{Forestry}Commission has aquired a third of the lightest sandy land which is now set with conifers. The remaining area is heathland conserved by the Norfolk Naturalist Trust.
